markdown.markdown:
Below are some projects that are hosted on [my GitHub](https://github.com/lawalter). These featured repositories showcase my past and present use of different programming languages and frameworks. I regularly work in R and I have experience with R Shiny, R Markdown, Quarto, and creating R packages. Moving forward, I am excited to pick up Julia and try out the Genie framework. The GitHub icon {{< fa brands github title = "Example GitHub icon" >}} in each card links to the project repository. ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
gardenhelpr
![](images/gh_app.png){fig-alt="Screenshot of Garden Helper application" fig-align="center"} Complete 2022-2023 [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to Garden Helper repository" >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/gardenhelpr)

I created the [gardenhelpr](https://github.com/lawalter/gardenhelpr) R Shiny app to assist in backyard garden planning. The app generates an interactive visualization of companion and antagonist plants from the user's input. A full list of friends and foes can be downloaded as a csv.

`#R` `#RShiny` `#ggplot2`

::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
Colorband Combination Generator
![](images/app_img_m.png){fig-alt="Screenshot of Colorband Combination desktop app" fig-align="center"} Complete 2020 [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to Colorband Combination Generator repository >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/colorband-app)

The [Colorband Combination Generator](https://github.com/lawalter/colorband-app) app was created with R Shiny and packaged with Electron. It creates random color combinations for bird banding. Colors can be selected based on what's available in a banding kit, and selections are saved for future use via [shinyStore](https://github.com/trestletech/shinyStore).

`#R` `#RShiny`

::: ::: ## Data analysis ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
RHWO Parental Care
![](images/rhwo.jpg){fig-alt="Photo of Red-headed Woodpecker" fig-align="center"} Complete 2017-2023 [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to Red-headed Woodpecker parental care repository" >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/rhwo-parental-care)

The [RHWO Parental Care](https://github.com/lawalter/rhwo-parental-care) repository contains data, metadata, code, and figures pertaining to my Master's research data analyses.

`#R` `#tidyverse` `#ggplot2`

::: ::: ## Miscellaneous ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
Shiny Electron App Creation Guide
Complete 2020 [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to R Shiny Electron App repository" >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/r-shiny-electron-app)

I wrote a step-by-step guide to creating a desktop application with R Shiny on both macOS and Windows using Electron.

::: :::
